Mau Sampai Kapan Bule Bikin Ulah dan Mencoreng Citra Bali?
01 Nov 2019, 12:45 by Aditya Mardiastuti, Afif Farhan


Ilustrasi turis di Bali (Gede Suardana/detikTravel)

Jakarta - Baru-baru ini, viral bule tawuran di Bali. Mungkin, Bali secepatnya bikin aturan tegas buat mengurus turis nakal dan bikin ulah!Video bule-bule berkelahi di depan salah satu kelab malam di Seminyak, Kuta, Badung, Bali, lagi-lagi bikin heboh di media sosial. Beberapa media internasional memberitakannya, seperti Daily Mail media asal Inggris.BACA JUGA: Viral Bule Tawuran, Kualitas Turis ke Bali Turun?Sebelumnya tercatat ada sejumlah turis-turis yang melecehkan tempat suci, pura-pura gila karena kehabisan bekal, maupun kasus bule yang berbuat kriminal di Pulau Dewata.Bali yang menjadi top destinasi di Indonesia pun kerap mendapatkan bule-bule berulah yang mencoreng citra pariwisata. Duh!


Foto: Bule-bule berkelahi di kawasan Seminyak, Bali (Dok. Istimewa)

FOKUS: Bali Vs Turis GembelDalam catatan detikcom, kasus bule atau turis yang bikin ulah di Bali sebenarnya sudah menjadi perhatian Pemprov Bali. Gubernur Bali Wayan Koster, mengaku sedang menyusun peraturan daerah (Perda) yang mengatur tentang pariwisata termasuk mengatur tingkah laku turis."Ya kita mengarah ke sana. Target di eksekutif Desember ini selesai, tentang kualitas penyelenggaraan kepariwisataan Bali sekarang hampir selesai draft awalnya, tinggal diskusi lagi," kata Koster kepada wartawan di Denpasar, Bali, Selasa (16/10) lalu.


Gubernur Bali Wayan Koster (Aditya Mardiastuti/detikcom)

Tokoh adat di Bali pun angkat suara. Bendesa Agung Majelis Desa Adat (MDA) Bali, Ida Penglingsir Agung Putra Sukahet, berujar kalau ada turis bikin ulah, dideportasi saja."Kalau terjadi lagi seperti itu deportasi, saya kira untuk efek jera itu. Tidak boleh lagi datang ke bali atau boleh dikasih jangka waktu misal 10 tahun biar dia sudah tua dia sadar baru bisa ke Bali, yang begitu itu kan bisa dikoordinasikan dengan pihak imigrasi nanti desa adatnya bisa menulis surat supaya bisa dipersona nongratakan," usulnya.BACA JUGA: Turis Nakal di Bali, Harus Dideportasi atau Denda Besar?Kita tunggu saja, bulan Desember nanti, apakah Perda yang dikeluarkan Pemprov Bali bisa bikin efek jera untuk turis dan menjaga citra pariwisata Bali?Simak Video "Bule Panjat Tempat Pemujaan Hebohkan Kuta, Satpol PP Turun Tangan"[Gambas:Video 20detik](aff/aff)

Until when do you want to throw an act and smear the image of Bali?
01 Nov 2019, 12:45 by Aditya Mardiastuti, Afif Farhan


Illustration of tourist in Bali (Gede Suardana / detikTravel)

Jakarta - Recently, Caucasian brawl in Bali. Maybe, Bali will immediately make strict rules to take care of naughty tourists and throw tantrums! Caucasian tourists fighting in front of one of the nightclubs in Seminyak, Kuta, Badung, Bali, again making a scene on social media. Some international media reported it, such as the British Daily Mail. READ ALSO: Viral Bule Tawuran, Quality of Tourists to Bali Down? Previously there were a number of tourists who abused the holy place, pretended to be crazy because of running out of stock, and the case of Caucasians who did things criminals on the Island of the Gods. Bali, which is the top destination in Indonesia, often gets Caucasians who tarnish the image of tourism. Gosh!


Photo: Caucasians fighting in Seminyak, Bali (Special Doc.)

FOCUS: Bali Vs Tourist Gembel In detikcom notes, the case of Caucasians or tourists who throw tantrums in Bali has actually become the attention of the Bali Provincial Government. Bali Governor Wayan Koster, admitted that he is currently drafting a regional regulation (Perda) governing tourism including regulating tourist behavior. "Yes, we are heading there. The target at the executive branch in December is complete, regarding the quality of the implementation of tourism in Bali. again, "Koster told reporters in Denpasar, Bali, last Tuesday (10/16).


Bali Governor Wayan Koster (Aditya Mardiastuti / detikcom)

Customary figures in Bali also raised their voices. Bendesa Agung of the Bali Traditional Village Council (MDA), Ida Penglingsir Agung Putra Sukahet, said that if there were tourists making a tantrum, just be deported. "If it happens again like that deportation, I think for the deterrent effect. No longer be able to come to Bali or may be given for a period of 10 years so that he is old he realizes that he can only go to Bali, so that it can be coordinated with the immigration authorities then the traditional village can write a letter so that it can be charmed, "he suggested. READ ALSO: Naughty Tourists in Bali, Must be Deported or Big Penalty? Let's wait, in December, will the Bali Provincial Government's Regulation be able to create a deterrent effect for tourists and maintain the image of Bali's tourism?
